10 (4,889 of 5,008) |population_density_blank1_km2 = |population_density_blank1_sq_mi = |timezone = [[Atlantic Standard Time Zone|AST]] |utc_offset = -4 |timezone_DST = [[Atlantic Standard Time Zone|ADT]] |utc_offset_DST = -3 |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = CA-NS |coordinates_type = region:CA-NS_type:adm2nd |latd=44.7 |latm= |lats= |latNS=N |longd=65.2 |longm= |longs= |longEW=W |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = |elevation_ft = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code = [[Area code 902|902]] |blank_name =Dwellings |blank_info =11,038 |blank1_name =Median Income* |blank1_info =$37,024 [[Canadian dollar|CDN]] |website = [http://www.annapoliscounty.ns.ca/ www.annapoliscounty.ns.ca] |footnotes = *Median household income, 2005 (all households) }} '''Annapolis County''' ([[Canada 2006 Census|2006 population]] 21,438) is a [[county]] in the [[Canada|Canadian]] [[province (Canada)|province]] of [[Nova Scotia]] located in the western part of the province on the [[Bay of Fundy]]. The county seat is [[Annapolis Royal, Nova Scotia|Annapolis Royal]]. ==History== Established August 17, 1759 by Order in Council, Annapolis County took its name from the town of [[Annapolis Royal, Nova Scotia|Annapolis Royal]] which had been named in honour of Queen [[Anne of Great Britain]]. It was near the previous site of [[Port Royal, Nova Scotia|Port Royal]], the chief [[Acadian]] settlement in the area. The Acadians had been forcibly removed by British government officials in the 1755 [[Great Expulsion|Grand DÃ©rangement]]. By 1833, a number of reasons had been advanced for making two counties out of Annapolis County. Two petitions were presented to the House of Assembly in that year requesting that the county be divided. However, it was not until 1837 that Annapolis County was divided into two distinct and separate counties - Annapolis and [[Digby County, Nova Scotia|Digby]]. ==Demographics== {{col-begin|width=60%}} {{col-2}} '''Population trend'''Statistics Canada: [[Canada 1996 Census|1996]], [[Canada 2001 Census|2001]], [[Canada 2006 Census|2006]] census {| class="wikitable" |- ! Census ! Population ! Race ! Population ! Pct (%) |- | White | 20,730 | 98.04% |- | Black | 195 | 0.92% |- | Other | 175 | 0.83% |} {{col-end}} There are 10,404 households out of which 26.06% have children living with them, 36.50% are married couples living together, 25.46% are one-person households, and 11.98% are other household types. ==Communities== For a list of communities in Annapolis County, see [[List of communities in Annapolis County, Nova Scotia|List of Communities]] *'''Reserves''' **[[Bear River (part) 6]] **[[Bear River 6B]] *'''Census Subdivisions''' **[[Annapolis, Subd. D]] ==Access routes== Highways and numbered routes that run through the county, including external routes that start or finish at the county limits:Atlantic Canada Back Road Atlas ISBN 978-1-55368-618-7 Pages 76-77, 84-85 {{col-begin|width=70%}} {{col-4}} *'''Highways''' **{{jct|state=NS|Hwy|101}} {{col-4}} *'''Trunk Routes''' **{{jct|state=NS|Trunk|1}} **{{jct|state=NS|Trunk|8}} **{{jct|state=NS|Trunk|10}} {{col-4}} *'''Collector Routes:''' **{{jct|state=NS|Route|201}} **{{jct|state=NS|Route|221}} **{{jct|state=NS|Route|362}} {{col-4}} *'''External Routes:''' **None {{col-end}} ==Protected areas== *Cottage Cove Provincial Park *Delaps Cove Hiking Trails *[[Kejimkujik National Park]] *Upper Clements Provincial Park *Valleyview Provincial Park ==Attractions== {{commonscat}} *[[Bay of Fundy Scenic Drive]] *[[Mount Hanley Schoolhouse Museum]] *[[Annapolis Royal Historic Gardens]] (Annapolis) *[[Fort Anne]] (Fort Anne National Historic Site) *[[Port Royal National Historic Site]] *[[Upper Clements Park]] ==See also== * [[List of communities in Nova Scotia]] * [[Royal eponyms in Canada]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://ns1763.ca/annapco/annapcondx.html Photographs of historic monuments in Annapolis County] *[http://www.annapolisvalleytourism.com Annapolis Valley Tourism] *[http://www.fundycommunities.com/ Fundy Communities Development Association]
